title: Opaque 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dense blackberry and black cherry notes pick up soy, oregano, thyme and roast beef characteristics in this very dark style of Zin. The deep and rich palate offers concentrated black cherry syrup before revealing rustic touches of leather and tobacco. A hearty wine to match your roasted meats.

title: Pacific Rim 2014 Vin de Glacièr Made with Organic Grapes Riesling (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: The aromas of jasmine, apricot and bountiful white flowers are exuberant. It's richly sweet with honeyed flavors while maintaining a lovely sense of balance.
designation: Vin de Glacièr Made with Organic Grapes

title: Palliser Estate 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
description: This is an intriguing, complex rendering of Sauvignon Blanc. It's reasonably weighty and plush, yet marked by hints of tomato leaf, wet mossy stone and grapefruit that linger on the finish.

title: Stadt Krems 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: A rather closed nose wants to give little away, but the palate is zingy with yeast, grapefruit peel and fresh, greenish leafiness, all held with focus and poise. Very refreshing.

title: Starmont 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chocolate, plum and mocha make for an inviting entry to this wine. Cedar and gun flint season a smooth wall of youthful, polished tannin and integrated oak, with a lengthy finish.

title: Suavia 2013 Massifitti Trebbiano (Veronese)
description: This lively, elegant white, made with 100% Trebbiano, opens with heady scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate delivers white peach, crunchy pear, tangerine and a mineral note. Racy acidity provides balance and generates a crisp, clean finish.

title: Rivino 2014 Estate Viognier (Mendocino)
description: This is a simply delicious and assertive wine that smells like roses and lemon zest, tastes like fresh apricots and biscotti and has a tangy, appetizing balance. It will be super as an apéritif for a summer time outdoor dinner.

title: Roblar 2013 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Voluptuous white peach and lighter butter notes form a classic nose set against a chalky backbone of lemon verbena and pink apple skins. The palate is tightly knit with lime skins, quinine and pink grapefruit pith, proving versatile and tartly acid-driven in style.

title: Roblar 2014 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lush red berry and ripe cherry aromas meet with baked boysenberry pie and a suave vanilla character on the nose of this estate bottling. Earthy tones of graphite, turned loam and dried leather enhance the black cherry base fruit and the tobacco leaf spice.

title: Toccata 2012 Riserva Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Red spices, dill, tobacco leaf and a touch of dust decorate the red cherry base on this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Sangiovese, 10% Petit Verdot, 5% Merlot and 5% Freisa. There's lots of intriguing dried herbs to the palate, from dill to oregano, as well as pencil lead, crushed rocks and red berries.

title: Tramin 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of black cherry, violet and dark baking spice lead the nose on this thoroughly enjoyable, easy-to-drink wine. The savory palate offers up black raspberry, ground pepper and a hint of cocoa alongside mellow tannins. Drink soon.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A slight note of pear drop plays on the nose. The palate is juicy and vivid with citrus, green pear and some white pepper. Light on its feet, with an energetic force at its core and lovely concentration of citrus and herb notes, this fizzes away pleasantly. This is far too easy to drink and very, very refreshing.

title: Sedition 2013 Chenoweth Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A new effort from Jigar Vineyards, sourcing some very good grapes, Sedition is light, clear and lingering on the palate in cherry-cola, mint and dried herb. Balanced and on the lighter side in terms of body and tannin, it's ready for the table, with a juicy, persistent finish.

title: Pratsch 2015 Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: Raspberry notes flit from the glass, then the palate follows with zesty, appetizing lemon flavors and creates a perfect picture of summer-berried freshness and easy, enjoyable lightness. There is a backbone of fresh acidity that makes this a classy winner with and without food. The finish is clean and hints of ripe cherry.

title: Previous 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A nicely made wine at an attractive price, this offers crowd-pleasing elements of juicy black cherry, cassis and cedar around smoky oak and a medium-bodied concentration that remains succulent on the palate.

title: Provence Wine Maker 2015 Rose Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine comes from vines south of the Mont Sainte-Victoire and close to the edge of the Aix-en-Provence region. The cool vineyard site helps the wine keep extreme freshness. Plenty of wild strawberry flavors are lifted by acidity and a refreshing citrus edge.

title: Pursued by Bear 2012 Baby Bear Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Coming from two area standouts—Lewis and Phinny Hill vineyards—this wine shows appealing aromas and flavors of shaved coconut, Mounds Bar, cherry and baking spices. The barrel influence is prominent but it largely stands up to it.

title: Huia 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a dark, rich wine. Crisp edges of acid and soft tannins frame black cherry and espresso notes on the midpalate, while the finish is broad and supple in texture. Drink now–2022.

title: Il Falchetto 2015 Arneis (Langhe)
description: Citrus blossom, beeswax and white almond aromas float out of the glass. The juicy, full-bodied palate presents yellow peach, creamy pear and tangerine while a mineral note backs up the finish. Tangy acidity lends freshness and balance.

title: Greenwood Ridge 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: This assertive and refreshing wine smells powerfully fresh and herbaceous, and tastes crisp and citrusy like grapefruit juice. It comes off dry, medium bodied, nicely acidic, and extremely mouthwatering. It's a fine example of the type.

title: Domaine du Clos Gautier 2015 Oser Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owner Gilles Pedini believes in rich rosés, because this is dense and concentrated. Its weight shows in the superripe red fruit flavors, the spice and pepper, and the bitter edge. All these elements suggest a wine that needs to age a few months. Drink from the end of 2016.

title: La Tunella 2011 Picolit (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of chamomile flower, yellow peach and candied citrus zest lead the nose on this bright dessert wine. On the palate, notes of acacia honey, fig and sweet almond accent a core of mature apricot. Fresh acidity keeps it from being cloyingly sweet.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2015 Mimi en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Packed with fruit and spice, this is a great food wine. It is full bodied, rich with raspberry flavors gathered into a structure of light tannins and edgy minerality. The aftertaste brings out a crisper character.

title: Loimer 2015 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A little bit of green pear, a little bit of pepper and quite a bit of juiciness add up to a whole lot of easy-drinking fun on this light, dry and zippy Grüner. There's some spice and yeastiness around the edges, too. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Sorin 2015 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From vines growing close to Bandol and the sea, this juicy, red-fruit-flavored wine is full and soft, but with a refreshing character. Acidity and red-currant succulence show strongly at the end.

title: Judge Palmer 2012 Bavarian Lion Vineyard Malbec (Knights Valley)
description: This wine has a big presence of both fruit and body and yet is relatively tamed for the variety, the vintage and the appellation, finding balance in a tart, twisted knot of dark cherry, blueberry, black pepper and a distinct hit of fresh-cut roses.

title: Keenan 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and mostly from the producer's Spring Mountain District estate, with the remaining grapes, 28%, from Pope Valley. Heavy and spicy on the entry, it offers a striking combination of black pepper and mountainous sage. Drink now through 2020.

title: Mauritson 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Aged in a majority of French oak, and sourced from several vineyards, including many estate, this 100% varietal wine displays a subtle nuance of smoky leather, berry bramble and soft, integrated oak. It's rich, yet balanced with a peppery finish.

title: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)
description: Rich notes of ripe peach and plum hover over more homely, ripe apple fruit. This enticing nose announces yet another Viennese field blend of immense and immediate charm. The idea here is of an easy-drinking but never facile wine of total local character that expresses typicity, freshness and joy. The verve of fresh lemon zestiness carries from the first sip to the last crisp echo of aftertaste. This is lip smacking and moreish.

title: Meinklang 2015 Burgenlandweiß White (Burgenland)
description: Hints of aromatic orange peel and white summer blossom add a certain exotic headiness to an earthy white blend from Burgenland. The palate is slender but laden with appetizing fruit flavours on surprisingly light, delicate feet—the result of sunny summer days and cool nights. Drink this soon to make most of those enticing, primary fruit notes and lasting aromas.
